revised_title: The Structure and Function of the Compound Eye in Archichauliodes Insects
tldr: The authors studied the structure and function of the compound eye in Archichauliodes insects, a primitive type of endopterygote insect. They found that the eye has a unique ommatidial structure with eight retinula cells forming a long column. In the dark-adapted eye, four retinula cell bodies reach the cone tip, while in the light-adapted eye, a crystalline tract up to 100 µm long is formed by extensions of the cone. The study provides insights into the relationships between different types of eyes found in higher insects.
